title: Acer pseudoplatanus
summary: Acer pseudoplatanus, known as the sycamore in the British Isles and as the sycamore maple in the United States,[2]  is a species of flowering plant in the soapberry and  lychee family Sapindaceae. It is a large deciduous, broad-leaved tree, tolerant of wind and coastal exposure. It is native to Central Europe and Western Asia, from France eastward to Ukraine, northern Turkey and the Caucasus and southward in the mountains of northern Spain and Italy.
